Oh OK everything makes sense now. We are using different functions!
You are=
 using 1/(1+ exp(-4.9x)) and I am using 1/(1 + exp(-x)). If you
set the par=
ameter aResponse =3D 1/4.9 when you call the poly function it
will produce =
the same curve and values as you have been seeing. The
constant 4.9 you are=
 using just scales the input and is variable in
the code I am using. In oth=
er words it evolves to different values so
it is not constant at 4.9. If yo=
u look at the poly function's
signature you'll see that there is two input =
parameters. aNetinput and
aResponse and x=3D aNetInput/aResponse within the=
 function body.

--Shane

ve@...> wrote:
>

0.992

> f(1.5) =3D 0.999

> ...
> f(8)=
 =3D 1 (or something VERY close to it)

n approximations, found via

u'd like to know that your
